website_summaries.verdict: The 17" grill surface on this tripod fits a surprisingly large amount of food quickly.
pros: Folds flat for easy packing and storage
Lighter to carry than cast iron
Folds down to a small, very packable size
Use as a cooking grate or with a frying pan
cons: Shorter than expected – measures 34" tall at highest point

website_summaries.verdict: This lightweight cooking tripod is great for taking and grilling on a camp out.
pros: Grate can move up and down to get the right height for cooking
Easy to put together and take apart
Can also hold a pan for frying over the open fire
cons: This is a very lightweight cooking tripod and is not designed to hang a heavy Dutch oven

customer_reviews.title: Clever product: inexpensive, lightweight and compact
customer_reviews.text: Perfect! And assembly is snap - a four year old could do it! The tripod and grill are quite lightweight and compact, just what you need for a camping accessory! The grill, which is suspended from the mid-point of the tripod, can be raised or lowered with one hand to regulate temperature. Another nice thing about this is you can cook right on the grill or use the grill surface to hold a pot or pan. We also tried using it to hang a lantern - which was very effective. This is a clever product, inexpensive, lightweight and disassembles to be compact.
customer_reviews.author: ResearchPro

customer_reviews.title: Worked good for me.
customer_reviews.text: Works great for the price. Basic tripod set up. The rubber band strings that hold the poles together seemed like they would melt quickly, but did not after the first few uses (Will see, but not a big deal). The rack was a good size, enough to cook 10 ears of corn and hold a large kettle with lid to cook stew, also made burgers and brat right on the rack. Not a 5 star product cause I compared it to the homemade steel one my father had growing up. This is not that unit but a good product for the $$. Coghlan's makes decent camping equipment but don't expect ultimate durabiity with this unit.
customer_reviews.author: Gabby

customer_reviews.title: but overall good product.
customer_reviews.text: Tripod works as expected. Held my very heavy 8 qt cast iron pot and lid. No isses with tipping or lack of sturdiness. Sometimes chain will hang up when lowering or raising grate, but overall good product.
customer_reviews.author: Jeff

customer_reviews.title: Everyone at the campsite loved it. Cooked steak
customer_reviews.text: Everyone at the campsite loved it. Cooked steak, hot dogs, veggies, and warmed drinks over the fire. The simple design makes it easy to switch out the grill surface for a different one. I'm using the grill from inside a slow cooker because it fits in my camp box but the one it came with is fine. Its just larger than you'd expect.
customer_reviews.author: Ted Michael

customer_reviews.title: Works great to hold my lantern, I haven't tried cooking with it.
customer_reviews.text: I've only used this for a Coleman propane lantern, which it worked very well for, the reason for 4 stars is the product seems well made but I am unsure how well it handle being over a fire, it goes together very well and the poles are corded like most tent poles, so you aren't looking for sections of pole. It may be unfair of me to give this 4 stars simply because I haven't used it to cook with, it seems to be a pretty good product.
customer_reviews.author: Steven S. Nelson

customer_reviews.title: The legs were sturdy and the hanging grate worked well once we got ...
customer_reviews.text: Used this during an extended camping trip. We cooked almost daily on this over the fire. Everything from kebabs to a cast iron pot of beef stew. The legs were sturdy and the hanging grate worked well once we got the hang of it. No problems with melting and we had it over some hot fires. We liked that you can spin the grate easily which made allowed us to do some fun stuff like a slowly cooked pork roast and even a roasted chicken.
customer_reviews.author: DenverDavid

customer_reviews.title: Why didn’t I have one already???
customer_reviews.text: Why didn’t I have this sooner?? Made campfire cooking so much easier. My husband cooked 70 hot dogs on this for our son’s birthday. (Not 70 at one time) he said it was the only reason he got through it! Go get one now if you don’t own it. Cheap and good quality. Easy to put back in the original box for easy and space-saving storage!
customer_reviews.author: Becky Hanson

customer_reviews.title: Much Lighter And Easier To Store Than Cast Iron
customer_reviews.text: I like this Tri-pod grill because it is lighter weight than cast iron. It is easy to store and a snap to set up. Keep the fire at a reasonable height for cooking, and make sure the legs don’t get too close to the flames and you won’t have any problems. Add a disco ball rotating motor, and you have a rotating grill for even cooking!
customer_reviews.author: billie111

customer_reviews.title: I love this grill.
customer_reviews.text: A year ago I was in the market for a camp grill. Looking around I noticed that most of them were expensive, heavy, and between the grills and the extra fuel, they can be quite bulky. My neighbour showed me his tripod grill and I knew it was what I wanted. It's super light, easy to set up, cooks using the campfire and packs away to about the size of a delivery pizza box. The only problem was that at one point I accidentally dropped my skillet into the fire, but that was user error and not the grills fault. So still... 5 stars.
customer_reviews.author: John Sicks

customer_reviews.title: Good Product but product details were incorrect
customer_reviews.text: It's sturdy but I don't like that it doesn't have the shock-cord through the legs to keep them together. They are all just loose in the box and it makes it difficult to move off the fire when cooking.
customer_reviews.author: MontanaV

customer_reviews.title: Be the envy of everyone burning hot dogs on a stick.
customer_reviews.text: Probably the best camping purchase I have ever made. Camping in groups somebody inevitably asks where I got this and are blown away when I tell them i paid less than $20. The chain can be a pain to adjust and I have been thinking about replacing it with a wire or something that would slide smoothly through the guides. Also I recommend finding something to carry it in because the box will fall apart and the grate will be greasy and sooty. Other than that it was definitely worth the money and I lean on it heavily for campfire cooking.
customer_reviews.author: Derf Diggler

customer_reviews.title: Capming neccessity.
customer_reviews.text: I love this thing! Easy to setup, easy to use. Doesn't take up a lot of space. Took it camping set it over the firepit and started cooking, in the morning put the coffee pot on it and made coffee.
customer_reviews.author: Corey

customer_reviews.title: One flaw, otherwise good quality for the money.
customer_reviews.text: Overall, it seems like pretty good quality. There was one flaw that makes it a bit of a pain, though. There is a bungee cord in each of the legs that make collapsing the poles easy for storage. The bungee also AIDS in holding the structure together when moving it. During the first use, the fire (which was kept low) melted the bungee at the top of two of the legs. Now it just falls apart if you try to move it. I guess I'll have to river it together or something which will make it so I can't break it down.
customer_reviews.author: Chad B.

customer_reviews.title: Love this thing
customer_reviews.text: Love this thing, just put it over your fire and you are all set to cook. Make sure you get it stable before you put anything on it, I could put most my weight on the grill part once I got it set up right.
customer_reviews.author: Mibix

customer_reviews.title: LOVE this grill!!!
customer_reviews.text: Use this grill all the time and it works great. Very stable and built strong to load up with food to grill without the frame looking as if it will give out. Actually using again this weekend for a camping trip. Can't wait to get that smokey campfire grilled food. Mmmmm
customer_reviews.author: Joshua G

customer_reviews.title: Great deal.
customer_reviews.text: Awesome grill! Light weight, portable and durable. Just wish the actual grill folded......
customer_reviews.author: Michael Scott McBride

customer_reviews.title: Great for camping!
customer_reviews.text: We really like how this folds up compactly for camping. The only thing I would advise about is that sometimes based on how the clips sit on the grill, your food can tip the entire grilling surface over and your food will land in the fire. I think they should make the clips stationary because once it's over the fire, the whole thing gets so hot that you can't touch it without burning yourself. The next time we camp, we are bringing oven mitts and a way to keep the clips from sliding around the grill.
customer_reviews.author: Glucoze

customer_reviews.title: Good ti-pod, great for the price.
customer_reviews.text: I have had more than one brand of these and they all seem to last on or two seasons. This one is by far the least expensive and it lasts about the same. For $20.00 it can easily be replace every other season. If you only use them a few times a year it would last five or six years. We use ours at the fire pit in our back yard as well as camping. This is a light duty grill. If the Grill itself wears out before the legs do, replace it with a webber coal grill it will last 10 years.
customer_reviews.author: Alaska Moutian Man

customer_reviews.title: tripod goes together easily. my one concern is that the legs have ...
customer_reviews.text: everything arrived as expected. tripod goes together easily. my one concern is that the legs have bungee cords like tent poles have. I worry that they might melt. time will tell but for now I give it 4 stars
customer_reviews.author: sub hunterTop Contributor: Camping

customer_reviews.title: Purchased as a gift.
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this as a gift. It appears to be a good quality tri-pod. I'm hopeful that it will work well.
customer_reviews.author: Jonie Phillipi

customer_reviews.title: Wonderful
customer_reviews.text: You can't beat the price for this. Helped tremendously when cooking while camping. Wish I had purchased earlier.
customer_reviews.author: D Lewis

customer_reviews.title: Awesome for camping;  pretty pleased.
customer_reviews.text: So this works like you'd expect it to. It isn't too flimsy or cheap. It is a little finnicky with the carbiner type hooks that connect the chains to the grate that hangs over the fire. I had some steaks get stuck on the grate and pull the contraption to the ground; however with lighter food it was no problem. In any case, for $20 it is a good deal in my mind if you want to cook over a campfire. We were the envy of our camping neighbors!
customer_reviews.author: Dog Lover 1024

customer_reviews.title: This tri pod works good the only problem i had was the cord inside ...
customer_reviews.text: This tri pod works good the only problem i had was the cord inside that is inside broke the second day that i used it while i was cooking over the fire now it is harder to put it together. The legs get very hot and breaks the cord for easy put up and take down.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Love this tripod
customer_reviews.text: Love this tripod, I've used it on two week long camping trips so far this summer and it has made cooking over the fire so much easier. Love that it packs down so compact, fits into my chuck box easily. Would definitely recommend this to a friend!
customer_reviews.author: Fox Fairy

customer_reviews.title: Good deal.
customer_reviews.text: Does everything it should at a good price. It's a little choppy to lower the platform with little or no weight on it, butt works great once something is on it. The people who say the cords melt are probably trying to cook over a bonfire. I've had no issues with the cords melting or with the poles getting to hot. Control the size of your fire or wait to until a larger fire (I love a nice big campfire myself) dies down to put the tripod over it.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Nice price and works great!
customer_reviews.text: Works great! Very compact and easy to set up. Took it camping and might have sold three of them to people who passed by. Don't know what else to say, buy one and you won't be disappointed. I was not.
customer_reviews.author: Chris

customer_reviews.title: If you like camp fire food, you need this!
customer_reviews.text: This tripod is awesome! My husband has used it several times for making dinner over the fire. We bought 2 and have never regretted it!
customer_reviews.author: Diane R Sutton

customer_reviews.title: Great
customer_reviews.text: I have yet to use this with a fire underneath, but I did set it up in my living room to get a feel for it and I am fully satisfied. I put some weight on it to see how it would hold up, and it didn't have any problem supporting a heavy cast iron griddle with 2 pots and a pan all stacked on top of each other, so I have no doubt that this will work great in a camp setting.
customer_reviews.author: R. Cook

customer_reviews.title: Folds up super small and works perfect
customer_reviews.text: Folds up super small and works perfect. Recommend for camping or just campfire cooking in your backyard. Pizzas, eggs, bacon, the skys the limit.
customer_reviews.author: C. Esenther

customer_reviews.title: Classic and functional gear
customer_reviews.text: For car camping, this is a great item! Coffee pot over the campfire... classic and functional. Cooking over the fire, heating something.... I only worry about the elastic cord inside the legs getting too hot.
customer_reviews.author: Jaxn

customer_reviews.title: Must have!
customer_reviews.text: Absolute must have for camping trips or even your own campfire at home. Makes the campfires possible when you don't have a grate to cook on.
customer_reviews.author: Misti

customer_reviews.title: Nicely made and convenient
customer_reviews.text: Brought this camping and everyone kept asking where I got this. I told at least 20 people. Nicely made and convenient
customer_reviews.author: jason

customer_reviews.title: Must have for camping!
customer_reviews.text: Workes perfect for cookingniver the fire or holding our lantern.
customer_reviews.author: Weston and Kathryn

customer_reviews.title: looks great
customer_reviews.text: I just got this in the mail from Amazon Wharehouse for $19.50 and free shipping as it was part of an order over $35. I set this up in the apartment and I like how it adjusts and I can see how to use this without any damage to the connecting bungy cord that holds the poles together. I like how it breaks down and stores. Winner. It holds my big DO without any worries. Seemed pretty stable. I wonder how it would work flipping burgers on the grill. I can't wait to try it.
customer_reviews.author: lawrence lee

customer_reviews.title: Great camping accessory
customer_reviews.text: Sturdy and holds up to high heat. Grill surface good for a mid sized skillet, medium pot, or a couple of burgers and dogs, etc...
customer_reviews.author: Llasertheintubator

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: We absolutely love this...a MUST HAVE for camping! You can't beat the price and the portability of it.
customer_reviews.author: Sarah Jayne Gach

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Husband is very pleased with this. He used it while camping. He is really into outdoor cooking.
customer_reviews.author: Jennifer Johnson

customer_reviews.title: fragile and shipping charges
customer_reviews.text: I bought this grill and tripod to see if it will fit my needs. Unfortunately the grill looks a little bit fragile and not stable after assembling. Surprisingly the manufacture company charges for the return!!! Overall I do not recommend this product.
customer_reviews.author: Darek

customer_reviews.title: The chain takes a bit of getting used to but overall very useful.
customer_reviews.text: Bought this item becuase my dad had been using one for years on our camping trips. They really are handy and don't take up too much room. The chain takes a bit of getting used to but overall very useful.
customer_reviews.author: A. Garcia

customer_reviews.title: Awesome!
customer_reviews.text: Couldn't be happier with this purchase... We used it on a snow camping trip a couple weeks ago for the first time and all our friends commented on how handy it was... Put our breakfast burritos directly on the grill and it worked like a charm!
customer_reviews.author: Krystal

customer_reviews.title: Tri-Pods kick butt
customer_reviews.text: I wish it came with a carrying case. I have bought these in the past and love them but they never come with a case. A plastic bag only lasts so long. My wife made one from some fabric from the store. Seriously though, you can't beat cooking on one of these. Raise and lower to the exact heat you want, works on uneven terrain and you can spin it for a rotisserie effect. Anytime I cam with people and they see this they love it (except for the gas grilling people but they aren't real campers anyways). P.S. The poles snap together because of the bungee cords inside of them much like a tent pole.
customer_reviews.author: L. Landwehr

customer_reviews.title: OK Grill
customer_reviews.text: Grill is ok enough. Poor instructions so had to wing it, but not too difficult. Legs are slightly warped or bent. Can't put a lot of weight on the grill, so be careful with weight of food you are cooking. Decent enough as a back up grill for emergency situations.
customer_reviews.author: Penelope40

customer_reviews.title: Tri-Pod Campfire Grill
customer_reviews.text: This grill works great. I like the easily adjustable height feature, allows for moving the grill up and down with food on while cooking without taking everything off or dumping in the fire.
customer_reviews.author: W. Vlasak

customer_reviews.title: Great item for camping
customer_reviews.text: We use this every time we go camping and it works wonderfully. We've had it for two years now and so far have had no issues. It cleans easily and folds up nicely for storage.
customer_reviews.author: Cathie

customer_reviews.title: I would recommend this product to anyone that is thinking of cooking ...
customer_reviews.text: Just what I wanted. I have used these before and know it will meet my expectations. I would recommend this product to anyone that is thinking of cooking over an open fire.
customer_reviews.author: Dave

customer_reviews.title: I love it! Much cheaper on here than in stores ...
customer_reviews.text: So far, I love it! Much cheaper on here than in stores locally.
customer_reviews.author: ddouth

customer_reviews.title: its ok...
customer_reviews.text: it feels cheap, like the Coleman products made in china. The metal is thin and I fear it wont last more than a couple seasons. It does work fantastically as a lantern holder, but standing over the heat of a fire is going to wear on it quickly.
customer_reviews.author: D

customer_reviews.title: Questionable packaging, great product
customer_reviews.text: Although it was new the packaging looked as if it was open-box. Ultimately loved the product. Slightly bigger than expected, which isn't a bad thing. But I wouldn't bring this on a lightweight hiking/camping trip.
customer_reviews.author: Kevin

customer_reviews.title: bought for my parents camping and they absolutely love it. It is actually a great tripod for ...
customer_reviews.text: bought for my parents camping and they absolutely love it. It is actually a great tripod for more than a dutch oven
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Works as expected. Materials are kind of cheap but ...
customer_reviews.text: Works as expected. Materials are kind of cheap but for the price and compared to what's on the market, it's great
customer_reviews.author: Stephanie

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Was just what I wanted. It should work well and should last for awhile.
customer_reviews.author: gene

customer_reviews.title: A must for any traditionalist
customer_reviews.text: If you want to cook over a fire get this. Just used it for 4 days straight and did it all. No need for the more expensive brands
customer_reviews.author: Doug

customer_reviews.title: This is a great multi-purpose tripod that I consider a must have for ...
customer_reviews.text: This is a great multi-purpose tripod that I consider a must have for camping. It's great for cooking meals in foil or directly on the grate.
customer_reviews.author: Nic Hallanger

customer_reviews.title: MELTED!
customer_reviews.text: MELTED on our 1st use over a camp fire! Total waste of $.
customer_reviews.author: kristi marie

customer_reviews.title: Kinda cheap
customer_reviews.text: A little on the cheap side. Not sure how long it will last.
customer_reviews.author: Teresa

customer_reviews.title: Broke second day
customer_reviews.text: Bought it for a camping trip and one of the legs broke by the end of day 2... The good news is I was still able to use it. The three legs fold in on themselves into four sections for better storage, a wire of sorts down the center keeps the four pieces together, the wire broke thus now I have to keep track of four polls instead of one. Nothing a little electrical tape didn't fix. I'm sure it will all crumble before long and will be of no use to me but camping happens once a year for me usually so it may make it 2 more times.
customer_reviews.author: aaron

customer_reviews.title: Didnt last long
customer_reviews.text: It broke right away. The cables snapped on it. Very disappointed in this product.
customer_reviews.author: Steve Sain

customer_reviews.title: Coghlan's Tri-Pod Grill and Lantern Hanger
customer_reviews.text: Coghlan's Tri-Pod Grill and Lantern Hanger is very nice for use over a fire or for just placing a lantern. Good quality and nice design.
customer_reviews.author: A. Taylor

customer_reviews.title: Camping
customer_reviews.text: Our neighbor had one of these. We were eager to puchase one and read it came with a cover which it did not. Now we have to find something to store it in. Makes it hard to put it in the camper without the bag for storage.
customer_reviews.author: Kay

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Works as expected and collapses so it does not take up a lot of room in transport.
customer_reviews.author: WagsTop Contributor: Cooking

customer_reviews.title: use a lot... one of strings for ...
customer_reviews.text: use a lot...one of strings for legs broke right away tho.
customer_reviews.author: Jody

customer_reviews.title: great for grilling
customer_reviews.text: I used it a a camping bbq device for many years and it's excellent. Well, I had to get a replacement after 5 or 6 years of camping trips.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Fine
customer_reviews.text: Haven't used it yet but all seems to be good.
customer_reviews.author: Christy

customer_reviews.title: fun product
customer_reviews.text: we loved this product so much that we bought one for everyone we know its fun to cook over the open fire like that
customer_reviews.author: stephen william axtman

customer_reviews.title: A handy tri-pod
customer_reviews.text: We love this tri-pod grill for this camping accessory called the SCOFF. It is simple to lower up or down near the fire or to adjust the temperature for cooking. Definitely would recommend it...
customer_reviews.author: Cis

customer_reviews.title: Great product, POOR design
customer_reviews.text: This grill was just what I expected, until I started using it. The poles are kept together via a bungie cord (similar to tent poles), which makes absolutely no sense for this product, considering it is using near a heat source, which will cause the bungie cords to "melt" and malfunction. Once this occurred, the poles would not stay together when moving the grill and would require the use of thick gloves to handle the hot metal and put back together. I do not recommend this grill and unfortunately, I am already past the return window, so I cannot return this product. Read the descriptions carefully and find another grill to use that does not employ bungie cords.
customer_reviews.author: onelivestarfish

customer_reviews.title: Tripod is a Camping Must!
customer_reviews.text: The Coghlan Tripod Grill and Lantern Hanger is a great product to have for camping or backyard fun. It is a great way to cook your food over the campfire or even just hang your lantern on after dark. It is a well made product and can be used year after year. We love using this on all our camping trips.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Love It!
customer_reviews.text: Great item for fishing at night. I haven't used it as a grill yet, but it GREAT as a lantern stand without the grill piece. Works so well this is the second on I ordered. If I catch enough fish, maybe I'll try the grill.
customer_reviews.author: Johnny Gomer

customer_reviews.title: It's okay.
customer_reviews.text: Not as sturdy as I'd hoped. I would trust a pot/pan on the hanging base...it'll do for now.
customer_reviews.author: Derek B

customer_reviews.title: Good Deal
customer_reviews.text: This handy tri-pod serves two purposes. great over the campfire for cooking or makes a good lantern holder. Very pleased and not over priced.
customer_reviews.author: T. Bye

customer_reviews.title: Damaged box
customer_reviews.text: Seems like a returned product. The box was in horrible condition and the amount of tape was even more alarming. Have yet to use it but initial impression is disappointed
customer_reviews.author: T

customer_reviews.title: worked great. Easy to set up and put away and ...
customer_reviews.text: Used it on our last camping trip to cook hamburgers, worked great. Easy to set up and put away and worked very well. Definitely worth the money.
customer_reviews.author: Leo

customer_reviews.title: Tripod grill
customer_reviews.text: It sets up nicely and looks exactly like the picture. It is stable and won't blow over in the wind easily. Looking forward to using it.
customer_reviews.author: happy mom 123

customer_reviews.title: Great Product!!
customer_reviews.text: The most fun around the fire ever!! Everyone that sees it wants one!! Never mind using certain types of wood to get different flavours on grill. Every fire enthusiast should have one.
customer_reviews.author: Andrew

customer_reviews.title: great tripod!
customer_reviews.text: This is an excellent addition to anyone's camping gear. Allows you to cook over a fire at varying heights to control heat and to have your own clean surface for cooking rather than some of the awful pits you'll find!
customer_reviews.author: P. Parker

customer_reviews.title: Arrived Broken
customer_reviews.text: Arrived looking like it had been opened and retaped again. Cord was broken on one pole making it impossible to put together. A tripod doesn't work with only two good legs. Going camping in two days. Thanks a lot for a used broken item that I can't utilize.
customer_reviews.author: AJ

customer_reviews.title: Finally Found One!
customer_reviews.text: We were looking high and low around our area to find one of these. We got it pretty darn fast. This tripod has made many meals at camp. Every camper needs to have one of these and this one is a great one to get!
customer_reviews.author: Lori

customer_reviews.title: Excellent!
customer_reviews.text: My son was very happy to receive this! They love to camp and will get alot of use out of it. The price was very good!
customer_reviews.author: tes

customer_reviews.title: durable function
customer_reviews.text: Great gear for very good price. Very durable easy to build and works great. good hanger for lanter at ninght too
customer_reviews.author: Petr Valenta

customer_reviews.title: Great purchase
customer_reviews.text: Exactly what I was looking for at a very good price. Exact same product as the one made by Coleman but a lot cheaper!
customer_reviews.author: D. Morgan

customer_reviews.title: HPC
customer_reviews.text: We brought one of these about 10 yrs ago..Needed to replace..We love using this Tri-pod grill...We coat it with veg oil before use and it works great. It is also a conversation starter with other campers. Suggestion: always use long cooking utencils and grill mitts
customer_reviews.author: HPC

customer_reviews.title: Had it for 1 year before the wire inside fell ...
customer_reviews.text: Had it for 1 year before the wire inside fell apart. Since boxes deteriorate quickly, it's hard to store all of the pieces together, so I ended up losing one of them when my boyfriend cleaned the basement. Overall, it was worth it for the price though.
customer_reviews.author: Samantha Franzen

customer_reviews.title: Good enough for me!
customer_reviews.text: Used twice so far, works pretty well. I just wish the grill part had raised edges like some of the far more expensive competitors do.
customer_reviews.author: EvilBob

customer_reviews.title: tripod grill
customer_reviews.text: This is a great product for camping. Cooking on a wood fire is great. would recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Sharon Przybyla

customer_reviews.title: Sent the wrong item
customer_reviews.text: DON'T ORDER FROM "RED GEAR." I ordered this item and they sent me a propane grill. When I tried to return it they said (I'm paraphrasing here)unless you have a printer, you're outa luck. I would give this seller zero stars if it were an option. Unfortunately I can't give a review on this item, and for that I appologize.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

product_meta.title: Coghlan's Tri-Pod Grill and Lantern Hanger
product_meta.description: Item Package Quantity:1Quick and easy to set up, the Coghlan's Tri-Pod Grill and Lantern Hanger enables you to cook food over a campfire at just the right height for the perfect amount of heat. The 17-inch chrome grill offers stability and easy height adjustment (up to 34 inches), and it's supported by a four-piece tripod made of galvanized steel. The tripod's legs are shock-corded together (for a maximum height of 62 inches), collapse for easy storage, and can support up to 30 pounds. When not used for cooking, it can be used to hang a lantern to light your campsite. Coghlan's makes the outdoors more comfortable and enjoyable with over 450 accessories for camping, hiking, fishing, and RVing -- from cooking gear to first aid kits, insect netting, firestarters, tent repair, and more.
feature_bullets: Tripod sets up over camp fire with height adjustable, 17-inch grill; can also be used for hanging a lantern to light campsites when cooking is done
